# 09. Business Rules & Compliance

## 1. Overview
This document defines the critical business rules, compliance requirements, AI/ML governance, advanced analytics policies, accessibility standards, and business logic constraints that apply across the shopping mall system. These principles ensure operational discipline, minimize risk, support data-driven innovation, and maintain robust legal and ethical practices.

## 2. Core Business Rules
- THE system SHALL enforce transactional integrity for all order-related operations.
- WHEN a seller updates product information, THE system SHALL validate for prohibited content and regional restrictions.
- WHEN promotions or loyalty campaigns are launched, THE system SHALL validate user eligibility and compliance with jurisdictional rules.
- IF a customer account is flagged for suspicious activity, THEN THE system SHALL initiate enhanced authentication and limit transactional abilities until resolution.
- WHERE AI/ML personalization is used, THE system SHALL provide opt-out mechanisms, complying with relevant privacy laws (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).

## 3. Legal & Regulatory Compliance
- THE system SHALL log all roles' access to sensitive customer or transactional data for auditability (GDPR Article 30).
- WHEN receiving or processing personally identifiable information (PII), THE system SHALL encrypt data at rest and in transit.
- IF there is user data deletion or account closure, THEN THE system SHALL enforce proper data erasure in alignment with applicable retention policies.
- THE system SHALL regularly review and update compliance checklists for consumer protection and e-commerce law (local and international).

## 4. AI/ML Features & Governance
- WHEN deploying new AI/ML models, THE system SHALL retain explainability information about inference decisions impacting users.
- THE system SHALL document and monitor potential bias in AI personalization or recommendations, enabling transparent review.
- IF an AI-driven promotion or recommendation engine is activated, THEN THE system SHALL monitor for unfair targeting or exclusion.
- THE system SHALL support user access to explanations regarding automated decision-making processes affecting order prioritization.

## 5. Advanced Analytics
- WHERE advanced analytics dashboards are accessible, THE system SHALL anonymize all individual user data and restrict sensitive attribute exposure.
- THE system SHALL enable granular audit trails for all analytics queries executed by admins or sellers.
- WHILE exporting analytics datasets, THE system SHALL enforce mandatory masking of PII and critical business data.

## 6. Accessibility & Inclusive Design
- THE system SHALL comply with WCAG 2.1 AA standards across all user-facing interfaces.
- WHEN new features are released, THE system SHALL validate accessibility using both automated tools and manual review.
- THE system SHALL provide alternative text on all media and support screen reader compatibility for primary workflows.

## 7. Overarching Constraints
- THE system SHALL allow only authorized roles to perform actions within their assigned permission scope.
- WHEN system configurations are modified, THE system SHALL create immutable logs for compliance review.
- IF there is a detected deviation from business rules, THEN THE system SHALL alert admins for enforcement action.

---

# Product Management: AI-Driven Shopping Mall System

## 1. Overview
Product Management is the core service enabling sellers and admins to register, update, and manage products‚Äîincluding options, bundles, categories, inventory, and rich media. It also supports AI-based recommendation, product history, and ensures scalability for large catalogs.

- Provide seamless workflows for product registration, modification, and updates
- Enable complex product options, bundles, and hierarchical category management
- Ensure precise inventory tracking and revision history
- Support high performance and scalable catalogs
- Deliver AI-driven product recommendations to optimize sales

## 3. User Personas
- **Seller**: Manages catalog, adds/edit products, handles bundles, monitors stock
- **Admin**: Oversees all products, bulk management, ensures compliance
- **Customer**: Browses products, options, bundles, and receives AI recommendations

## 4. User Journeys
- **Product Registration**: Sellers and admins enter product data‚Äîincluding title, pricing, categories, images, rich content, and options. Sellers can view and edit their product history.
- **Product Update**: When a product‚Äôs information changes, a new version snapshot is saved for audit from previous state.
- **Option/Bundle Management**: Sellers create products with variants (e.g., color/size) or product bundles; inventory logic linked accordingly.
- **Inventory Management**: Inventory quantities are automatically adjusted upon order, return, or stock event.
- **Recommendation Experience**: Customers see AI-personalized recommended products based on browsing and purchase history.

## 5. Functional Requirements
- THE product management system SHALL support create, read, update, delete (CRUD) operations for products (EARS Ubiquitous).
- THE system SHALL allow media uploads (images, videos) per product, supporting multiple formats and thumbnails (EARS Ubiquitous).
- THE system SHALL track inventory per product/option and update in real-time when an order is placed or canceled (EARS Event-Driven).
- WHEN a product is updated, THE system SHALL preserve a snapshot of the previous version with timestamp and user ID (EARS Event-Driven).
- WHERE a product uses option sets, THE system SHALL allow flexible configuration of variants and price/stock per option (EARS Optional).
- WHEN inventory drops below seller-defined threshold, THE system SHALL notify the seller (EARS Event-Driven).
- IF a product is marked out of stock, THEN the system SHALL prevent checkout for that product (EARS Unwanted Behavior).
- WHERE a seller creates a bundle, THE system SHALL aggregate inventory checks and pricing (EARS Optional).
- THE system SHALL categorize products using a multi-level hierarchical structure for efficient navigation and filtering (EARS Ubiquitous).

## 6. Non-Functional Requirements

- THE system SHALL ensure consistent API response times < 500ms under peak loads.
- THE system SHALL provide audit logs for all product lifecycle changes.

Product Management is the core foundation of a shopping mall system, enabling sellers to register, update, bundle, and manage both simple and complex products. ## Objectives
- Provide robust mechanisms for product lifecycle management from registration, editing, versioning, to status changes (active, inactive, archived).
- Allow for rich product detail configuration including pricing, descriptions, media, categories, and options.
- Support complex product types such as bundles, options, and multi-attribute SKUs for effective inventory control.
- Integrate AI-powered features (such as automated recommendations and content tagging) to maximize discovery, conversion, and operational efficiency.

- **Seller**: Authorized merchant responsible for product registration, managing inventory, updating details, configuring promotions, and bundling offers. Sellers may have small or extensive catalogs and require tools for both batch and one-off updates.

- **Customer**: End user browsing the catalog, filtering/searching products, and engaging with recommended or themed lists generated by the Product Management system. May interact with product variations and bundles.

1. **Seller registers a new product**: 
    - The seller logs in, navigates to the product management dashboard, and selects ‚ÄúAdd Product.‚Äù
    - The system provides a structured, guided entry form supporting title, category, multi-option/variant setup (e.g., size, color), price, quantity, description, media upload, tags, and AI-suggested keywords.

2. **Seller updates inventory**:
    - When inventory falls below a set threshold, the system notifies the seller. Seller updates stock or sets the product as out-of-stock/hidden.
3. **Customer browses catalog**:
    - Customer filters/searches using keywords, categories, tags (including AI auto-tagged products), and explores bundles/related products based on AI recommendations.

- THE system SHALL permit batch updates for price, inventory, or category reassignments.

## Overview

    - Customer filters/searches using keywords, categories, tags (including AI auto-tagged products), and explores bundles/related products based on AI recommendations.

## Functional Requirements

- WHERE AI recommendation is enabled, THE system SHALL auto-generate tags and recommend category placement and bundles.
- THE system SHALL permit batch updates for price, inventory, or category reassignments.
